channel.title: Articles | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - get the latest breaking news, showbiz & celebrity photos, sport news & rumours, viral videos and top stories from MailOnline, Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: French prosecutors claim Sudanese 'boy', 16, who died trying to reach England is actually 28
item.description: The prosecutor investigating the death has said an identity document found on the body of the 'boy', who fell into the Channel last night, suggests he is actually 28 years old.

item.title: QUARTER of all GCSE pupils get A/A* equivalent grades
item.description: Some 25.9 per cent of pupils received a grade 7 to 9 today, while 76 per cent received at least a grade 4 (C). These figures were both much higher than those last year of 20.7 per cent and 67.1 per cent.

item.title: Manchester Arena bomber's terrorist brother will NOT be condemned to die behind bars
item.description: Hashem Abedi (pictured) the brother of Manchester Arena bomber Salman, will not spend his life behind bars, despite helping his sibling organise an attack that killed 22 people at a concert in 2017.

item.title: Doctor, 36, banned from treating patients for beating his wife is allowed back to work
item.description: Dr Abdul Basit, 36, had been suspended from duty at the Cumberland Infirmary, Carlisle, after he grabbed his spouse by the throat and manhandled her during a string of arguments.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: One in 10 firms say there is a risk they will go bust
item.description: The ONS today published the latest results of its Business Impact of Coronavirus Survey and it suggests large swathes of the British economy are still struggling to get back on their feet.

item.title: Prince Albert's daughter Jazmin Grace Grimaldi speaks out after being hospitalized with Covid-19
item.description: Grimaldi, 28 from California, first announced she had contracted the virus in early July, saying her symptoms included 'debilitating' migraines and a fever that lasted for three or four days.

item.title: Could Wigan be freed from lockdown? Andy Burnham says it's 'clear' measures have to worked
item.description: Official figures show the city of Birmingham's infection rate has more than doubled over the past fortnight, with around 25 new cases of coronavirus for every 100,000 people.

item.title: New BTEC results chaos as board AXES plans to announce grades tomorrow with just 18 hours notice
item.description: The shock 11th-hour move affects 450,000 pupils in the UK, all due to collect results this morning along with GCSE candidates.

item.title: Germany records its highest number of coronavirus cases since April
item.description: Germany has recorded 1,707 new cases of the coronavirus in the past 24 hours, the highest daily toll since April, official figures showed Thursday.

item.title: A-level pass rate rises to RECORD high after switch to teacher-assessed grades
item.description: The proportion of A-level entries receiving an A grade or higher has increased to a record high for England, with 38.1% awarded top grades.

item.title: Worker drops dead in Brazilian supermarket but colleagues cover him up with umbrellas
item.description: The incident occurred at a store in the northeastern state of Recife after sales manager Manoel Moisés Cavalcante suffered a heart attack on August 14.

item.title: Leading Putin foe Alexei Navalny 'is poisoned' and rushed to hospital
item.description: Alexei Navalny, Vladimir Putin's arch political rival and critic, has been rushed to hospital after falling sick on a flight from the city of Tomsk to Moscow, amid claims he was poisoned.

item.title: Silverback gorilla and his son watch caterpillar in their Higashiyama Zoo enclosure
item.description: Shabani, a 23-year-old silverback and his son Kiyomasa watch the creature slowly crawl towards them in their enclosure at Higashiyama Zoo in Japan, before he cruelly flicks it away.

item.title: Lockdown-free Sweden records its highest number of deaths in a six-month period for 150 years
item.description: Its the highest tally from January to the end of June since 1869 when 55,431 people died, largely because of a famine.

item.title: British Army trials hybrid-powered military vehicles to improve stealth
item.description: The Jackal 2 mobile weapons platform and the Foxhound protected patrol vehicle will be refitted with the new hybrid systems - with testing starting in November.

item.title: Jeremy Corbyn attacks LABOUR MPs for showing him 'a great deal of hostility' as party leader
item.description: Mr Corbyn, who was replaced by Keir Starmer in April after leading the opposition to humiliation at the 2019 general election, made the remark in an interview with a left-wing politics podcast.

item.title: London Fire Brigade celebrate their all-female fight-fighting crew
item.description: London Fire Brigade shared a photo of the five-strong team in a Facebook post last week and admitted having all women responding together remains 'incredibly rare'.

item.title: Two-thirds of BAME people feel police are biased against them, survey reveals
item.description: Almost three-quarters (73%) of respondents to the Hope Not Hate survey said they support the recent Black Lives Matter protests (pictured).

item.title: Mother of two, 28, ditches veganism for raw meat diet - eating raw chicken, intestines and egg yolks
item.description: Jo Tyler, 28, from Williamsburg, Virginia, adopted a 'primal diet' consisting raw or minimally processed foods after she became more ill as a vegan and struggled to keep weight on.

item.title: One dead and multiple injured at a 3,230ft-long glass slide in China
item.description: Downpours occurred while the tourists were using the glass-bottomed track yesterday, causing them to lost control of the speed and bump into each other, said a beauty spot in north-eastern China.

item.title: Gmail and Google Drive crashes for thousands of users around the world
item.description: It appears the outage is a global one, with a large concentration of issues centered in Europe and Australia. Outage tracker site DownDetector picked up problems 7:24am BST.

item.title: Barack Obama flames Donald Trump for 'making stuff up and teargassing peaceful protesters'
item.description: Barack Obama unleashed on President Donald Trump, saying the administration would do anything to win even if it meant tearing down America's democracy.

item.title: The fashion firm where girls just wanna have fun - and lose £26m
item.description: CHRISTOPHER STEVENS: The whole thing is just a big laugh, of course. If I don't get that, it's because I'm a stale old chauvinist who can't bear to see young women running a business.

item.title: Two million women have lost access to contraception across the world because of coronavirus
item.description: The World Health Organisation said earlier this month that two-thirds of 103 countries reported sexual and reproductive health services had been disrupted between mid-May and early July.

item.title: Police Code Zero viewers slam 'soft' sentence handed to driver who dragged policeman 650ft down road
item.description: Sgt Nick Morley and his team had stopped James Williams, 23, to question him after he drove his Mercedes through a stop sign in Thornton Heath, south London in 2018.

item.title: US won't seek death penalty against pair of IS militants
item.description: The US Justice Department says it will not pursue the death penalty against two Islamic State militants suspected of behead Western hostages, removing a hurdle to them facing justice in America.
item.media:description: FILE - In this March 30, 2019, file photo, Alexanda Amon Kotey, left, and El Shafee Elsheikh, who were allegedly among four British jihadis who made up a brutal Islamic State cell dubbed "The Beatles," speak during an interview with The Associated Press at a security center in Kobani, Syria. The Justice Department has notified the British government that it will not pursue the death penalty against two Islamic State militants suspected in the beheadings of Western hostages, removing a hurdle in the potential prosecution of the men in the United States. The decision, revealed in a letter Wednesday, Aug. 19, 2020, could allow Britain to began sharing evidence with federal prosecutors in the U.S for any potential case against El Shafee Elsheikh and Alexanda Kotey. (AP Photo/Hussein Malla, File)

item.title: Man who was haranguing rail staff for not wearing masks is knocked unconscious
item.description: Police are investigating after a passenger who was arguing with Clapham Junction staff about face masks was knocked out by a man in a grey hoodie.

item.title: Mike Ashley eyes up Covid casualties: Sport Direct boss wants to expand his empire into empty stores
item.description: Sport Direct boss Mike Ashley wants to take advantage of empty stores shut down during the coronavirus pandemic in shopping centres to expand further

item.title: Premier League fixtures released as Liverpool face Leeds, Arsenal and Chelsea in tricky start
item.description: Premier League champions Liverpool have been handed a brutal start to the defence of their title with games against Leeds, Chelsea and Arsenal to begin the 2020-21 season.

item.title: Semi-autonomous lane-keeping systems in cars is a 'nascent technology'
item.description: Thatcham Research, one of the UK's leading vehicle safety firms. said that 'serious questions remain' in regard to these system's capability and questioned if they will function on 'smart' motorways.

item.title: Lancashire boy, 15, is pushed off his bike by a man in a passing car
item.description: The schoolboy and his friend were left 'shaken up' when a man driving past pushed them off their bikes on a country lane in Rivington, Lancashire.

item.title: Britain will get brief snatch of summer and 77F heat today... before tail of Storm Ellen
item.description: The storm, which contains the remnants of Tropical Storm Kyle, moved in from the Atlantic on Tuesday night.

item.title: Not on the High Street millionaire Holly Tucker urges women to start their own lockdown businesses
item.description: Holly Tucker MBE, 43, from London, took to Instagram as she encouraged women to launch lockdown businesses, saying: 'If you can't find a job, maybe you should create your own!?'

item.title: Government U-turn means 1.5million teenagers could get marks equivalent to the old-style A/A*
item.description: The proportion of A/A* equivalent grades to be awarded this year is set to rise by almost 30 per cent, as Education Secretary Gavin Williamson faces widespread calls for him to resign.

item.title: Hundreds of thousands of GCSE pupils share memes as they await fate
item.description: Teenagers in England, Wales and Northern Ireland will get their final results today, the higher of either their teachers' estimated grade or the moderated grade.

item.title: Gavin Williamson was personally told in JULY that the exam grade system was flawed but carried on
item.description: School Standards Minister Nick Gibb confirmed he former director-general Sir Jon Coles to discuss his fears that the system was inaccurate and would unfairly penalise poorer state pupils.

item.title: STEPHEN GLOVER: Why I fear Boris Johnson's silence on exam fiasco heaps arrogance upon incompetence
item.description: STEPHEN GLOVER: Where is Boris? We are told he's camping in Scotland with fiancée Carrie Symonds and baby son Wilfred. It's hard to imagine him banging in tent pegs.

item.title: Modern royals including Prince Harry and Meghan Markle will not feature in The Crown
item.description: Creator of The Crown, Peter Morgan, revealed modern royals such as the Duke and Duchess of Sussex will not feature in the final two series of the drama as there was not 'enough distance'.

item.title: Sephora Australia Alphie Sadsad reveals the eight eye shapes
item.description: An Australian celebrity makeup artist has revealed the foolproof tips to apply makeup without dramatically altering the shape of your eye shape.

item.title: Online grocery shopping by over-55s increases by more than a third
item.description: More than half of British adults aged 55 and over now shop online for their groceries, according to figures released in a new report by Waitrose.

item.title: Wonder treatments in your own kitchen cupboard that could help you stay healthy
item.description: From easing eczema with porridge oats to whitening your teeth with sage and treating sore eyes with fennel - the Mail reveals the other, sometimes very surprising, natural medicines at home.

item.title: Children are 'silent super spreaders' of Covid-19, scientists claim
item.description: Youngsters can carry larger amounts of the virus than adults, which confers with increased ability to transmit the virus to others, scientists at Massachusetts General Hospital claim.

item.title: Japanese drinkers sleep in street after heavy alcohol sessions
item.description: Take a walk around Okinawa, southern Japan, at night and you may stumble upon revellers snoring in flowerbeds, on pavements - and even in the middle of the road.

item.title: Tricky brainteaser challenges puzzlers to spot the lost engagement ring in a vegetable patch
item.description: UK jewellers William May created a mind-boggling brainteaser after discovering that Brits are most likely to lose their rings in the garden - so do you think you can beat the 20 second record?

item.title: From hot tubs to fire pits, what Britons splashed out on in lockdown
item.description: Whilst the shutters came down on shops in March and Britons were banned from leaving their homes, households took to online shopping to spend their hard-earned cash instead.

item.title: People who completely missed the joke left others in hysterics as they point the obvious
item.description: Social media users from around the world have shared examples of someone who simply just didn't understand what was funny, with the best posts compiled in a Bored Panda gallery.

item.title: The things you MUST buy in your twenties and thirties if you want to be rich
item.description: Nicholas Muscat, who shares his financial advice on YouTube AussieMoneyMan , said he made the list based on a combination of research and the best things he has bought so far.

item.title: From red carpet to real life...SUSANNA REID: Results week was like a slow motion car crash
item.description: SUSANNA REID: Round two of results in our house, and this morning my GCSE son will receive his grades. There will be no algorithm, no complex ranking of classmates, no computer saying no.

item.title: Never-before-seen footage shows inside the NXIVM sex cult
item.description: A new nine-part HBO documentary, which airs Sunday, gives compelling insight into New York sex cult NXIVM, showing the time the Dalai Lama spoke at their event and detailing the cult's work.

item.title: Portland protester, 25, is on the run and begging for money after kicking unconscious a truck driver
item.description: Protester Marquise 'Keese' Love, 25, is allegedly begging for money after he was identified as the suspect who fled the scene of a brutal attack on a truck driver in Portland on Sunday night.

item.title: Good Samaritans lift SUV off woman after she was hit while crossing road in Manhattan
item.description: The unidentified woman was hit while crossing the street in Midtown Manhattan on Wednesday and ended up pinned under the SUV before bystanders rushed in to help.

item.title: Two directors who dated 'sex-for-roles' actress accused of blackmailing NBCUniversal's Ron Meyer
item.description: Two sources familiar with the scandal that led to Meyer's abrupt ouster from NBCUniversal identified Neil Marshall and Joshua Newton as two of the individuals who sought to extort the mogul.

item.title: NEU demands reduced content for A-levels and GCSEs in 2021 as students find tests 'too stressful'
item.description: Bosses at the National Education Union (NEU), the UK's largest teaching union, have written to Education Secretary Gavin Williamson, warning coronavirus spikes could lead to 'loss of schooling'.

item.title: White Tube racist knocked unconscious hands self in to police
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: Billy Steele, 31, who was filmed launching the shocking tirade on a Central Line tube, is understood to work for the family-owned business S&S Steel Fixing Limited.

item.title: Harris opens third night of Democratic convention that put women first
item.description: Sen. Kamala Harris bucked tradition and opened up her night at the Democratic National Convention, asking supporters to make a voting plan.

item.title: Hillary Clinton pleads with voters to back Joe Biden - accusing 2016 victor of 'stealing' election
item.description: The former first lady and 2016 nominee addressed the Dem convention Wednesday night, urging Democrats to vote in 'overwhelming' numbers so Donald Trump can't 'steal' the election.

item.title: I met boys from Sudan on a beach nearby. There's only one word on their lips - England
item.description: The Sudanese young man who drowned trying to paddle a 'toy blow-up boat' to England with a shovel as an oar was following a dream shared by hundreds of African boys living in Calais, writes SUE REID.

item.title: Doctors are told to be frank with patients who have obesity to save taxpayers millions
item.description: Instead of persuading their patients to lose weight, UK doctors are taking the easy way out and prescribing expensive 'bariatric' equipment to assist the chronically heavy with everyday living.

item.title: Snake catcher removes a huge python while family keep watching their show like nothing happened
item.description: Tony Morrison, the owner of Redland's Snake Catcher, arrived at a home in Cleveland, south of Brisbane, to dispatch of the serpent on Wednesday.

item.title: Can an hour of hypnotism cure your biggest fears? FEMAIL writers put to the test online session
item.description: Three Femail writers, each with differing demons - a fear of mice, smoking and imposter syndrome - try out a one-off online session with leading British hypnotist Freddy Jacquin.

item.title: Inside the daily food habits of a weight loss specialist
item.description: An Australian personal trainer and nutritionist has shared her balanced daily food habits in a bid to explain why 'dieting' isn't the answer to weight loss.

item.title: Ex-Navy SEAL who killed Osama bin Laden tweets maskless selfie aboard flight
item.description: Former Navy SEAL Robert O'Neill, 44, posted a maskless selfie from a Delta flight on Wednesday afternoon which was quickly deleted after he faced intense backlash.

item.title: Crew 'were having a birthday party' as the vessel was torn apart off Mauritius, it is claimed
item.description: The MV Wakashio struck a coral reef off the Indian Ocean island on July 25. A maritime official said the crew had been questioned about reports they were having a party on board.

item.title: Many people making wills in pandemic named executors but failed to tell them
item.description: Should someone refuse to be your executor you might have to change your will, and pay an amendment fee to do so.

item.title: Polyamorous Emma Fedigan is dating a married man on the side who her five kids call their 'sparent'
item.description: Polyamorous mum Emma Fedigan, 37, from Perth, who was 'bored' of her monogamous relationship with her husband is now dating a married man who her kids refer to as their 'sparent'.

item.title: Diplomatic row looms after Briton who was jailed for drug crimes in Singapore is caned 24 times
item.description: Ye Ming Yuen, 31, who went to £41,000-a-year Westminster School, was strapped to a large wooden trestle before being caned 24 times at Changi Prison in Singapore yesterday.

item.title: Six bottlenose whales die in largest live stranding of its type in Ireland's history
item.description: The seven northern bottlenose dolphins were spotted stranded on a beach in Rossnowlagh, County Donegal, on the north west coast of Ireland, earlier today.

item.title: Donald Trump rage-tweets at Barack Obama after his predecessor calls him a threat to democracy
item.description: President Donald Trump rage-tweeted in all-caps during the Democratic convention as predecessor Barack Obama said Trump was incapable of taking his office seriously.

item.title: Britney Spears's conservatorship unchanged after court hearing as she fights for freedom from dad
item.description: The star, 38, failed to remove Jamie Spears, 68, from controlling her business and personal affairs Wednesday after a court made no immediate changes to the conservatorship.

item.title: Satellite images capture single Chinese nuclear submarine entering 'Bond lair' cave complex
item.description: Satellite images have captured a Chinese submarine entering a cave complex beneath the mountain at Yulin Naval Base on Hainan Island. It's believed to be the first sighting of the entrance.

item.title: Cuff justice! Police officer is forced to call 999 for help getting out of his handcuffs
item.description: Northamptonshire Police sergeant Scott Renwick had to call the fire service to release him from a pair of handcuffs after he got stuck in them during a demonstration.

item.title: 'Bored' Tower of London ravens sneaking away from the site in search of food due to lack of tourists
item.description: The legendary birds, which are shrouded in myth, are lacking stimulation due to a lack of visitors and two have already been caught sneaking out of the precincts of the Tower of London.

item.title: Labour narrows Tory lead to just two points as poll shows support for Boris Johnson plunged
item.description: A YouGov poll found that public support of the Tories had dropped four points to 40 per cent while Labour was up three to 38 per cent from last week's survey.

item.title: PAUL THOMAS on... hands-free motoring
item.description: 'You may well have your hands full - but in driverless cars you travel in the FRONT'

item.title: What does YOUR face say about you?
item.description: While western medicine should be relied upon to treat and prevent serious health concerns, two Australian face mapping experts have revealed common 'signs' that could help identify problems.

item.title: CRAIG BROWN: In a huff? Then you'll be happy in Umbrage
item.description: CRAIG BROWN: A few days ago, my colleague David Jones wrote a fascinating piece about East Grinstead, identifying it as 'The Town That Went Sects Mad'.

item.title: BBC News at Six and 10 shows 'could be AXED within 10 years', corporation executive says
item.description: Fran Unsworth has predicted that news will be in 'the digital space' and the BBC's output will be consumed via iPlayer on tablets and smartphones 'for young people'.

item.title: Stay-at-home mother shows off transformation after losing 100LBS in a year on CICO diet
item.description: Georgia Malbrough, 26, from Houma, Louisiana, started following the CICO (calories in, calories out) weight loss plan in June 2018.

item.title: Anti-obesity drives are a fat lot of good if Turkey Twizzlers are back on the menu
item.description: Food writer ROSE PRINCE gives her thoughts on the return of the Turkey Twizzler. They were discontinued in 2005 but now the meaty spirals are making a come back says Rose.

item.title: Golden State Killer's ex-fiancee stares him down from the front row during surprise court appearance
item.description: Bonnie Ueltzen, left, was in court for day two of Joseph DeAngelo's, right, sentencing hearing Wednesday. She was engaged to DeAngelo in the early 1970s before breaking it off.

item.title: Air Canada passenger wakes up to find the window he was sleeping against had a huge CRACK in it
item.description: Karl Haddad, 20, was flying from Toronto to Montreal. He immediately fell asleep, but soon woke up to notice part of his window was open, with the plastic around the glass showing a big crack.

item.title: Skin cancer deaths more than DOUBLE in 50 years as British sunseekers jet abroad on cheap holidays
item.description: Official figures from Cancer Research UK reveal people are dying from melanoma skin cancer at 2.5 times the rate they were in the 1970s as more Brits jet abroad on cheap holidays.

item.title: The Femail Face-off: Should working out in the park be banned?
item.description: Kitty Dimbleby says NO, 'we should encourage people, not shame them' while Julie Burchill says YES, 'these gym morons have more hench than sense'.

item.title: Women who have a premature baby are twice as likely to die young, new study suggests
item.description: The greater risk of death is highest in the first decade after birth but it persists for up to 40 years, researchers led by the Swedish Research Council found.

item.title: Carol Burnett files legal docs to become temporary guardian of 13-year-old grandson Dylan
item.description: It's a full-circle decision for the 87-year-old legendary comedian, whose parents Joseph and Ina were both alcoholics and she was raised by her maternal grandmother Mabel 'Nanny' Jones

item.title: Slingshot spider launches itself 100 times faster than cheetah by creating spring coils in its web
item.description: Launching from a spring-like web, the slingshot spider can accelerate 4,300 feet per second and withstand 130 Gs. It's one of the only animals that uses a tool - its web- to achieve its speed.

item.title: Scottish teacher launches campaign to be reunited with his wife after being thrown out of China
item.description: Martin O'Brien, from Scotland, was held in solitary confinement in a bare jail cell and interrogated before being kicked out of China and separated from his wife.

item.title: SEBASTIAN SHAKESPEARE: John Terry is slide-tackled over plans to build a garage for his supercars
item.description: SEBASTIAN SHAKESPEARE: Few will ever emulate John Terry's enviable life path - from beginnings in Barking, Essex, to captain of the England football team and a £40million fortune.

item.title: Skirt suits to mix & match: The new 'soft' power dressing is professional - but never prim
item.description: FEMAIL's Jess Wood picks out the power skirt suits for your return to the office. The skirt suit is back, but not as we know it. It's relaxed, and it's hardly a 'suit' at all, since it doesn't match.

item.title: 'Morning people' who wake up early at higher risk of Alzheimer's
item.description: A team from Imperial College London studied over half a million individuals and analysed their genetic information as well as sleeping patterns.

item.title: Bride is being THREATENED by her bridesmaid over canceled wedding
item.description: The unnamed bride shared her story on Reddit's 'Am I The A**hole' forum, explaining that the bridesmaid 'used to be a friend of her husband'.

item.title: Say so long cellulite in just 8 weeks! Beauty guru Kate Shapland shares revolutionary advice...
item.description: Kate Shapland, 56, British founder of leg-care brand Legology promises results in eight weeks following her plan. The plan includes avoiding sugar, starch and practicing body brushing and massage.

item.title: HSBC shoots down Bank of England's optimism over the economy
item.description: Britain's biggest bank has slashed its own expectations for the UK's economic recovery, putting it at loggerheads with the Bank of England's chief economist Andy Haldane.

item.title: Wellcome Prize 2020: Photo account of depression battle wins
item.description: Uzbekistan-born photographer Arseniy Neskhodimov created the collection, called Prozac, at his parents' house and in Sharm el Sheikh, Egypt. The series explores his experience of depression.

item.title: Tess Holliday hits out over 'hatred' of 'fat people' after strawberry dress goes viral
item.description: Holliday, 35, took to social media to share photos and videos of herself wearing the pink tulle frock by designer Lirika Matoshi to the Grammys in January.

item.title: Perfect for dodging the jams! Engineer converts £30 fairground bumper car into 8mph road vehicle
item.description: Chris Acock, 53, created the distinctive two seater by merging an old fairground car with a mobility scooter. He now frequently turns heads when driving it on the streets of Portland, Dorset.

item.title: Man wraps car in CELLOPHANE after woman blocks driveway
item.description: Tobe Bailey, 49, from Margate, Kent, wrapped his neighbour's blue Vauxhall Corsa in black cellophane after she blocked his driveway for more than a day.

item.title: Prison diversity officer, 51, 'had inappropriate relationship with inmate at Wormwood Scrubs'
item.description: Ex-HMP Wormwood Scrubs officer Pamela Belonwu, 51, entered into the relationship with inmate Clifton Thomas while he was at the prison in White City, Isleworth Crown Court heard.

item.title: Tiny Robo-beetle is powered by liquid methanol-fuelled 'muscles'
item.description: Roboticists from California developed the bug-sized 'RoBeetle' - which weighs in at less than 1/100th of an ounce - to explore new means of propelling tiny machines.
